lines.text: Hey Leroy, you want my dessert tomorrow? You want it the next day? You can have it! At church, we get refreshments all the time. Chocolate cake and cookies, ice cream...
Oh, yeah? Who gives 'em to ya?
The minister.
Why? Is he crazy?
No. I think he's rich.

[reading the story of Christmas]
And, lo, the Angel of the Lord came upon them...
Shazaaammmm!
What?
Out with a vengeance in the darkness, the mighty Marvel!
Gladys, I don't know what you're talking about.
The Mighty Marvel in Wonder Comics.
No, this is the Angel of the Lord.
Out of nowhere, right? In the black night, right?
Well, yes, in a way.
Shazaaaammmm!
I don't know what shepherds wear.
You have to wear your father's robe. That's what I have to do.
He doesn't have a robe.
What does he hang around the house in?
His underwear.
I am not going to be a shepherd.
Oh, yes you are!
Mom said Mrs. Slocum was in traction. How can she talk on the phone if she's in traction?
What do you think traction is?
Like when they put you to sleep.
No such luck.
What's an "Inn"?
It's like a motel.
Why'd they go there?
To pay their taxes.
At a motel?

[to the camera about the Herdman's visit to church]
Before the service was over, they cleaned out the collection plates, scribbled on the bibles, and stuck gum all over the pews.
I'm going to be Mary in the Christmas play. And if you try to be, or raise your arm, you'll wish you didn't.
I'm always Mary in the Christmas play.

Go ahead then. And next spring when the pussy-willows come out, I'm going to stick a pussy-willow so far down your ear where nobody can reach it. And it'll sit there and grow and grow and grow so for the rest of your life, there'll be a pussy-willow bush growing out of your ear.
Vera Wendlekin says all they do is talk about sex and underwear.

[referring to a shack exploding]
Who said the Herdmans did it?
They said they did. Ralph said he was the one that stole the chemistry set from Old Man Johnson's garage.
Call the police, then they can put Ralph in jail.
Alice, nobody's going to call the police on them.
Because they're kids.
No, because they burned down the jail.
Somedy better be Herod!
Imogene, we're going to do this play the way it has always been done.

[grabs Charlie by the collar]
I know! Let Charlie be Herod. He tells the wise men to kill Jesus, and they say "okay" 'cause he's a king and all.
But then they don't do it. They go back and get Herod...
[gesturing stabbing motions]
"Take that, Herod! Take that!"
I'm not going to be Herod!
What did she says the play is called?
"Christmas Pageant."
That's no name. That's what it is.
I know a name. I'd call it "Revenge at Bethlehem."
Who's Herod in this play?
Uh, Herod isn't in this play.
You mean he's out to kill the baby, and he isn't even in the play?
